contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=February 2013}} [[File:Kichijoten, the Goddess of Good Fortune.jpg|thumb]] '''Kisshōten''' (吉祥天), also known as '''Kichijōten''', '''Kudokuten''' (功徳天), '''Laksmi''', '''Mahasri''' or '''Sri-mahadevi''' is a [[Japan]]ese female divinity. Adapted from the [[Hinduism|Hindu]] goddess [[Lakshmi]] she is sometimes named as one of the [[Seven Gods of Fortune]], replacing [[Jurōjin]].<ref name=BritishMuseum>{{cite web|title=Wooden figure of Kichijōten|url=http://www.britishmuseum.org/explore/highlights/highlight_objects/asia/w/wooden_figure_of_kichij%C5%8Dten.aspx|publisher=The British Museum|accessdate=27 August 2012}}</ref> She is considered to be the goddess of happiness, fertility, and beauty.<ref name=BritishMuseum/><ref>{{cite web|title=Kisshōten (Kichijōten)|url=http://www.philamuseum.org/collections/permanent/305645.html|publisher=Philadelphia Museum of Art|accessdate=27 August 2012}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Commons category|Kichijouten}} {{Jmyth navbox long}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kisshoten}} [[Category:Fertility goddesses]] [[Category:Japanese goddesses]] {{Japan-myth-stub}} {{Japan-reli-stub}}
